Dispersion¶

pycis.model.dispersion.get_refractive_indices(wavelength, material='a-BBO', sellmeier_coefs_source=None, sellmeier_coefs=None)[source]¶

Calculate the extraordinary and ordinary refractive indices as a function of wavelength

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, numpy.ndarray, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • material (str) – Set crystal material.

  • sellmeier_coefs_source (str) – Specify which source to use for the Sellmeier coefficients that describe the dispersion. If not specified, defaults for each material are set by sellmeier_coefs_source_defaults in pycis.model.dispersion.

  • sellmeier_coefs (dict) – Manually set the coefficients that describe the material dispersion via the Sellmeier equation. Dictionary must have keys ‘Ae’, ‘Be’, ‘Ce’, ‘De’, ‘Ao’, ‘Bo’, ‘Co’ and ‘Do’.

Returns

(ne, no) tuple containing extraordinary and ordinary refractive indices respectively. type(ne) = type(no) = type(wavelength).

pycis.model.dispersion.get_kappa(wavelength, **kwargs)[source]¶

Calculate kappa, the dimensionless parameter that gives a first-order account of material dispersion, as a function of wavelength

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, numpy.ndarray, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • material (str) – Set crystal material.

  • sellmeier_coefs_source (str) – Specify which source to use for the Sellmeier coefficients that describe the dispersion. If not specified, defaults for each material are set by sellmeier_coefs_source_defaults in pycis.model.dispersion.

  • sellmeier_coefs (dict) – Manually set the coefficients that describe the material dispersion via the Sellmeier equation. Dictionary must have keys ‘Ae’, ‘Be’, ‘Ce’, ‘De’, ‘Ao’, ‘Bo’, ‘Co’ and ‘Do’.

Returns

kappa. type(kappa) = type(wavelength)

pycis.model.dispersion.sellmeier_eqn(wl, c)[source]¶

Given a set of Sellmeier coefficients, calculate the extraordinary and ordinary refractive indices as a function of wavelength

Parameters

  • wl (float, numpy.ndarray, xarray.DataArray) – Wavelength in microns.

  • c (dict) – Coefficients that describe material dispersion via the Sellmeier equation. Dictionary must have keys ‘Ae’, ‘Be’, ‘Ce’, … and ‘Ao’, ‘Bo’, ‘Co’, … The form of Sellmeier equation used is determined by len(c).

Returns

(ne, no) tuple containing extraordinary and ordinary refractive indices respectively as a function of wavelength.

pycis.model.dispersion.get_sellmeier_coefs(material, sellmeier_coefs_source=None)[source]¶

Return the requested set of Sellmeier coefficients

Parameters

  • material (str) –

  • sellmeier_coefs_source (str) – Specify which source to use for the Sellmeier coefficients that describe the dispersion. If not specified, defaults for each material are set by sellmeier_coefs_source_defaults in pycis.model.dispersion.

Returns

dict containing the Sellmeier coefficients.
